task1.questionText: How is the end of a statement marked in Prolog?

task2.questionText: When the value of a variable doesn't matter, and we want to indicate that any suitable information is acceptable in its place, what should we write?

task3.questionText:
Given the following facts:```character(professor).
character(vicky).
character(mitnik).```Which query will return all characters?

task4.questionText: How to check if the element `3` is in the list `[1, 2, 3, 4]`?

task5.questionText:
Given the knowledge:```character(steve).
character(mitnik).
develop(mitnik, virus).```Write the rule `involved(X)` that will check if `mitnik` is involved in the case (i. e. if he developed the virus).

knowledge: friends(X, Y) :- (friend(X, Y); friend(Y, X)), X \= Y).
task6.questionText:
Given the knowledge:```friend(steve, robot).
friend(robot, professor).
friend(robot, sarah).
friends(X, Y) :-
	(friend(X, Y); friend(Y, X)), X \= Y.```Write a rule `second_friends(X, Y)` that checks if `X` and `Y` aren't friends but have common friends.
task6.hint: In your rule, use the predicate `friends(X, Y)`, not `friend(X, Y)`.

inception1_start.speaker: professor
inception1_start.dialogue: It's 5:00 AM! Who could have come at this early hour... Who are you?

inception1_02.dialogue: I need Robert Langdon. This is FBI Director Edgar Hoover speaking.
inception1_02.speaker: director

inception1_03.dialogue: Who?! Are you sure you need me specifically?!
inception1_03.speaker: professor

inception1_05.dialogue: Do you know what time it is?!
inception1_05.speaker: professor

inception1_06.dialogue: I apologize, but this matter cannot wait.
inception1_06.speaker: director

inception1_08.dialogue: Professor Langdon, this is a matter of life and death! I ask you to help your country! The survival of the planet depends on your assistance!
inception1_08.speaker: director

inception1_09.dialogue: You have intrigued me. What about my humble self has so fascinated the FBI that Director Hoover himself came to see me?
inception1_09.speaker: professor

inception1_10.dialogue: I’m not joking, Professor Langdon. Listen carefully! A group of hackers led by Kevin Mitnick has created a dangerous virus.
inception1_10.speaker: director

inception1_11.dialogue: It is capable of wiping all data from computer memory, disrupting the operation of the global network, and it spreads through simple communications.

inception1_12.dialogue: Last night, the computer of cybersecurity expert Sara Parker was hacked.

inception1_13.dialogue: Files were stolen, and this virus was released into the network. We have less than 20 hours left to create an antivirus.

inception1_14.dialogue: If we don’t create an antivirus in 'Prolog', the world will descend into chaos.

inception1_15.dialogue: There will be airplane crashes, spacecraft falling from orbit. Do you understand the scale of the disaster?!

inception1_16.dialogue: I understand, Mr. Hoover, but I'm not very familiar with 'Prolog'...
inception1_16.speaker: professor

inception1_17.dialogue: You are the best information security expert in the world. You learn new programming languages faster than anyone else. The fate of the entire planet is at stake!
inception1_17.speaker: director

inception1_18.dialogue: Alright, I will try to figure it out!
inception1_18.speaker: professor

inception1_19.dialogue: I should also inform you that Sarah Parker was abducted from her home last night.
inception1_19.speaker: director

inception1_20.dialogue: Her whereabouts are still unknown, but we managed to locate the very computer where the antivirus needs to be entered.

inception1_21.dialogue: I assume we're going there now?
inception1_21.speaker: professor

inception1_22.dialogue: Yes. The car is waiting downstairs. But be careful, in this abandoned mansion, there are traps everywhere that can be deadly.
inception1_22.speaker: director

inception1_23.dialogue: To disarm them, you need to enter the correct code. I believe in you, Professor Langdon! Call me anytime! Good luck!
inception1_23.speaker: director

inception2_start.speaker: professor
inception2_start.dialogue: Well, these overgrown plants... everything has grown wild. Oh, a lock. What could be encrypted here?

inception2_01.dialogue: Freeze! Stop, living creature! You wander in vain in these parts! No such creatures are allowed here!
inception2_01.speaker: robot

inception2_02.dialogue: Hello! My name is Professor Robert Langdon! What's your name?
inception2_02.speaker: professor

inception2_03.dialogue: Ah, you’re the professor, the best security expert. At first, I thought that it was the marauders again and that they would try to pick the lock. No one can enter the correct code.
inception2_03.speaker: robot

inception2_04.dialogue: And I am a third-generation robot model R3. I am not allowed to let any living beings through because no one knows about the deadly traps.

inception2_05.dialogue: Why have you come here, Professor Langdon?

inception2_06.dialogue: You are a model R3 robot, an assistant to humans. Your duty is to listen to and help any human. Isn't that right?
inception2_06.speaker: professor

inception2_07.dialogue: Kevin Mitnick created a virus that can cause a global network failure. He has already released it.

inception2_08.dialogue: We have less than 18 hours to create an antivirus in 'Prolog'. Will you help me learn it?
inception2_08.speaker: professor

inception2_09.dialogue: Yes, I have this functionality. But to study this language, you need to step away from conventional programming forms and comprehend the logic of Prolog itself.
inception2_09.speaker: robot

inception2_10.dialogue: Trust me, it is a very beautiful and logical programming language. Soon you will appreciate its beauty and potential.
inception2_10.speaker: robot

inception2_11.dialogue: I have no doubt about that. Shall we start the lesson now?
inception2_11.speaker: professor

inception2_14.dialogue: Very good. We've opened the lock and can now enter.

inception3_start.speaker: professor
inception3_start.dialogue: We’ve successfully completed the first task! I didn’t expect it to be done so quickly!

inception3_01.dialogue: Yes, you are very smart and perceptive, professor. I’m very happy for you!
inception3_01.speaker: robot

inception3_03.dialogue: Professor Langdon, this is FBI Director Edgar Hoover. I have urgent news for you!
inception3_03.speaker: director

inception3_05.dialogue: We managed to track Kevin Mitnick's location. He’s somewhere in the house. Be careful, professor! He might be armed!
inception3_05.speaker: director

inception3_06.dialogue: I understand, I have a weapon too, though I still don’t know how to shoot. Let’s hope we don’t need it.
inception3_06.speaker: professor

inception3_07.dialogue: Take care, professor, you have an important mission ahead! Goodbye!
inception3_07.speaker: director

inception3_08.dialogue: It's so dark and gloomy here! But I can’t delay. If Mitnick is somewhere in the house, I’d rather not run into him.
inception3_08.speaker: professor

inception3_09.dialogue: Let the FBI agents handle him. Let’s go upstairs!

inception3_10.dialogue: Be careful climbing, professor! Some steps on the staircase are traps. These are the next tasks.
inception3_10.speaker: robot

inception3_failTask2_01.dialogue: Be careful, Professor. I warned you that the tasks are the traps.
inception3_failTask2_01.speaker: robot

inception3_12.dialogue: Good, we can continue our path.
inception3_12.speaker: robot

inception4_start.speaker: professor
inception4_start.dialogue: Excellent, we're doing well! Let's move on! Oh, here we are again at a locked door. Another code needs to be entered...

inception4_01.dialogue: You’ve already completed 2 tasks! Don’t give up, professor!
inception4_01.speaker: robot

inception4_02.dialogue: Do you know that artificial intelligence has the potential to wipe out humanity?
inception4_02.speaker: professor

inception4_03.dialogue: Artificial intelligence was created to improve human life.
inception4_03.speaker: robot

inception4_04.dialogue: Everything requires human control. And until we learn to fully control artificial intelligence, we put ourselves at great risk.
inception4_04.speaker: professor

inception4_05.dialogue: Right now, our biggest danger is not finishing all the tasks in time – 6 hours left.
inception4_05.speaker: robot

inception4_06.dialogue: That's right, my friend! Let’s get to work!
inception4_06.speaker: professor

inception4_failTask3_01.dialogue: It seems we'll have to try again.

inception4_08.dialogue: Good, now we can enter the room.

inception5_start.speaker: professor
inception5_start.dialogue: I never imagined that such a cozy study would be hidden in this creepy house. It looks like someone was just here and left papers on the desk...

inception5_01.dialogue: A very cute and charming room.
inception5_01.speaker: robot

inception5_02.dialogue: There’s no computer here, so we’ll have to keep looking... Do you see this? The wall is moving aside...
inception5_02.speaker: professor

inception5_03.dialogue: Wow! Maybe Mitnick decided to return to his office?
inception5_03.speaker: robot

inception5_04.dialogue: I’ll hide under the table so no one sees me. Oh no...
inception5_04.speaker: professor

inception5_05.dialogue: There’s another hidden trap here. I accidentally triggered some mechanism and got stuck. Metal rods have come down around the table.

inception5_06.dialogue: Do you hear that? That’s the voice of my daughter...

inception5_07.dialogue: Wow! Look at this! It’s like entering another world from a dungeon. How cozy!
inception5_07.speaker: vicky

inception5_08.dialogue: Dad?! What are you doing here?!
inception5_08.speaker: vicky

inception5_09.dialogue: I was about to ask you the same question! I expected to find anyone here, but not you! How did you get here?!
inception5_09.speaker: professor

inception5_10.dialogue: I just knew you couldn’t do this without me! And you’d never have called me!
inception5_10.speaker: vicky

inception5_11.dialogue: Do you even realize how dangerous it is here?! How did you get in?
inception5_11.speaker: professor

inception5_13.dialogue: You hacked the FBI site again?!
inception5_13.speaker: professor

inception5_14.dialogue: Oh, dad, stop scolding me! Just admit it – you were waiting for me and you’re happy I showed up!
inception5_14.speaker: vicky

inception5_15.dialogue: You’re stuck under a table, how were you going to get out without me?
inception5_15.speaker: vicky

inception5_16.dialogue: We just need to complete the next task and enter the code.
inception5_16.speaker: professor

inception5_17.dialogue: With me, it’ll be faster! Just admit it!
inception5_17.speaker: vicky

inception5_18.dialogue: I’m sorry to interrupt your conversation, but time is running out. And anyone could walk in here!
inception5_18.speaker: robot

inception5_19.dialogue: Yes, you're right, we need to free my father and start searching for the computer!
inception5_19.speaker: vicky

inception6_01.dialogue: Let me help you get out, professor?
inception6_01.speaker: robot

inception6_02.dialogue: I can still manage to crawl out from under the table. Thank you! Quiet! Do you hear those sounds?
inception6_02.speaker: professor

inception6_05.dialogue: Sounds like some sort of mooing. The sounds are coming from that far corner of the room...
inception6_05.speaker: professor

inception6_06.dialogue: Let's go see who's there! We need to shine a flashlight...
inception6_06.speaker: vicky

inception6_07.dialogue: It's the kidnapped information security specialist, Sarah Parker! I’ll help you now!
inception6_07.speaker: vicky

inception6_08.dialogue: Are you Professor Langdon? My name is Sarah Parker! Kevin Mitnick kidnapped me last night! He's gone mad and must be stopped immediately!
inception6_08.speaker: sarah

inception6_09.dialogue: I knew the director would turn to you for help!

inception6_10.dialogue: Pleased to meet you, miss, I must admit I didn't expect to see you here!
inception6_10.speaker: professor

inception6_11.dialogue: Please help me get free! I know where the main computer is! We must hurry, time is running out!
inception6_11.speaker: sarah

inception6_12.dialogue: Let me introduce you to my daughter Vicky. We will complete the task together and enter the correct code to free you, miss.
inception6_12.speaker: professor

inception6_13.dialogue: I've heard so much about you, miss, no less than about your outstanding father. I believe in you, you'll succeed!
inception6_13.speaker: sarah

inception6_15.dialogue: Very well. Time to get to the computer room.
inception6_15.speaker: professor

inception7_start.speaker: sarah
inception7_start.dialogue: Thank you for helping me get free! Now we can't waste any time, let's move on!

inception7_01.dialogue: I agree, let's go. Look! This is the machine!
inception7_01.speaker: vicky

inception7_02.dialogue: It's not a supercomputer, but it's still powerful enough...
inception7_02.speaker: professor

inception7_03.dialogue: Look, the computer is on and it's loading some files. Let's see what's there?
inception7_03.speaker: sarah

inception7_04.dialogue: Here's a whole list of encrypted personal data of the US Mint employees. As far as I know, only 10 of them have access to the Fort Knox vault.
inception7_04.speaker: professor

inception7_05.dialogue: To access the vault, each of them must enter their part of the code, and then 'open sesame' will unlock the doors. In the entire history of Fort Knox, only three times have outsiders gained access.

inception7_06.dialogue: Who was lucky enough to gain such access? Why were they able to enter?
inception7_06.speaker: vicky

inception7_07.dialogue: The first to enter was US President Roosevelt in 1943. The second inspection only happened 31 years later.
inception7_07.speaker: professor

inception7_08.dialogue: The third inspection occurred in 2018 when rumors spread that there was no gold in the vault. But it turned out that all the gold was still there.

inception7_09.dialogue: I wonder, are the US Mint employees in on it with Mitnick, or does he plan to use them without their knowledge?
inception7_09.speaker: sarah

inception7_10.dialogue: We'll definitely find out later. Right now we need to stop the virus and enter the code before anyone interrupts us.
inception7_10.speaker: vicky

inception7_11.dialogue: Yes, let's get started. I'm ready.
inception7_11.speaker: robot

gameOver_1.dialogue: I shouldn't have wasted all my tries...
